page.title: 18ST. GEORGE'S CHURCH
page.content: George Fearn, a wealthy brewer, donated money to build this church which was one of many built in the 19th Century as the industrial towns of Northern England expanded. The church is built of Runcorn stone. It is 55m wide and 23m long. Its tower and spire rise 72m above the A6 road. A particularly interesting feature is the miniature stone replica of the tower and spire built by the architect, Austin, over the founders grave in 1910 in the cemetery across the road. The church has many interesting features, a nave, porches decorated by gargoyles, a font, pulpit and ornate windows depicting figures symbolic of the Faith. The church was consecrated on 25th February 1897 and is a thriving parish church today.
